Dispute_Type: Dispute over the validity of election results
Legal_Issue: Whether the EAC exhibited a reasonable apprehension of bias in its decision-making process
Evidence_Assessment: Relationship between EAC Elder Charlotte Joe and candidate Charlene Joe; EAC members signing the appeal petition
Legal_Rule: The test for reasonable apprehension of bias requires that an informed person, viewing the matter realistically and practically, would conclude that it is more likely than not that the decision-maker would not decide fairly
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged bias due to familial relationship and prior involvement in the appeal petition
Outcome_on_Merits: Not reached; decision set aside on procedural grounds
Review_Standard: Reasonableness and fairness of decision-making process
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Failure due to reasonable apprehension of bias
Key_Evidence_Considered: Familial relationship between EAC member and candidate; EAC members' participation in petition
Applicant_Challenge: LNIB and Mary June Coutlee challenged the EAC's decision
Evidence_Type: Documentary evidence (petition signatures), relational evidence (mother-daughter relationship)
Remedy_Requested: Quashing of EAC decision and re-determination
Outcome: EAC decision set aside; matter referred back to a new Council of Elders
Remedy_Sought: Remittal for determination by a new Council of Elders
Claimant_Status: LNIB and Mary June Coutlee as applicants
Pending_Relief_or_Application: Re-evaluation by newly constituted Council of Elders
Jurisdiction: Election disputes within Indigenous governance framework
Governing_Rule: Test for reasonable apprehension of bias
